subject: Re: [junit] Re: this.getClass().getClassLoader().getResource("/") is 	null
msgSnippet: ... First, something you probably don t want to hear.  You ve been asked to take code that hard-codes an assumption that it s being run inside a web container,
messageBody:
On Sun, Aug 8, 2010 at 7:01 AM, ajay <ajaytorgal@...> wrote:
> Thanks again. The provided class is working perfectly from its existence and task is to write test case without changing the source code. The provided solution may be an option provided I can change the source code. Please guide me to get through this test case.

First, something you probably don't want to hear. You've been asked
to take code that hard-codes an assumption that it's being run inside
a web container, and run it outside a web container. You may want to
talk to whoever's assigning this task (even if it's yourself), and see
if the tradeoff of the extra work you'll have to do, and the design
you won't be able to improve, is worth the benefit of not changing the
source code.

That said, you can probably hack something together using a custom
classloader, and use that classloader to load your class. Generalist
Java forums may be your best source of information on how to do this.
Good luck,

David Saff

>
